title: Bangladesh condemns bombing of Rakhine hospital in Myanmar
body: Bangladesh has condemned the recent bombing of a hospital in Myanmar's Rakhine state and expressed concern over the recent increase of violation of international humanitarian law and violence in the state. In a statement issued by the foreign ministry, Bangladesh government conveyed its condolences to the families of the deceased and sympathy for those affected. An airstrike by Myanmar 's military destroyed a hospital in an area controlled by a leading rebel armed force, Arakan Army, killing 34 patients and medical staff on Wednesday night, reports AP, quoting a rescue worker and independent media reports. About 80 other people were injured in the attack on the general hospital in Mrauk-U township. The military, which took over Myanmar's government in 2021 and has been fighting ethnic militias and armed resistance forces since then, has not mentioned any attack in the area. In the statement, Bangladesh underscored the importance of protecting civilians and civilian facilities without distinction, and emphasised that all communities, including Rohingya and Rakhine, should be spared from violence.
